intro: Tragia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsules that contain seeds, and it is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It has a short growth period and is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native range. Tragia guatemalensis is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
